title: The Great British Bake Off crowns its 2021 winner
description: Chigs, Crystelle and Giuseppe contested the Channel 4 show's closest finale yet, the judges said.

title: Bulgarian holiday bus tragedy hits young nation
description: There is little since North Macedonia's 1991 declaration of independence to compare to this.

title: Man Utd contact former Barcelona boss Valverde about interim post
description: Manchester United contact former Barcelona coach Ernesto Valverde about the role of interim manager.

title: Grammy Awards: Olivia Rodrigo dominates nominations for 2022
description: The freshly-minted pop star is up for the night's four biggest awards, including album of the year.

title: Kevin Sinfield completes 24-hour 101-mile MND run
description: The Leeds Rhinos legend ran his ultramarathon to raise money for motor neurone disease research.

title: Yalda Hakim: My return to Afghanistan
description: The BBC's Yalda Hakim - who was born in Afghanistan - reports on the impact of 100 days of Taliban rule.

title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
description: People in England are being advised to test for Covid before going to crowded places this winter.

title: Sir David Amess: Funeral service takes place at Westminster Cathedral
description: A message from the Pope is read out at the funeral mass for the late Conservative MP.

title: Polluting greenhouse gases being sold online and smuggled to UK
description: Experts say hydrofluorocarbons, which are used in fridges and aerosols, make global warming worse.

title: Councils to be forced to take child asylum seekers
description: More than a hundred children are living in hotels because of a shortage of places in care homes.

title: Bulgaria bus crash: Children among at least 46 killed
description: At least 46 people, including 12 children, died when a bus returning to North Macedonia caught fire.

title: Kevin Sinfield: Leeds Rhinos legend raises £900,000 after completing 24-hour 101-mile MND run
description: Kevin Sinfield raises more than £900,000 after running 101 miles in 24 hours on behalf of motor neurone disease research.

title: Andy Murray & Emma Raducanu to play in Mubadala World Tennis Championship
description: Britons Andy Murray and Emma Raducanu will take part in the Mubadala World Tennis Championship exhibition event in December.

title: 40-year mortgage deals pose questions for homeowners
description: The launch of long-term fixed-rate deals may test borrowers' appetite for certainty over cost.

title: Covid-19: Home working advised to curb spread
description: Stormont ministers are meeting to decide the way forward in the light of a high number of cases.

title: Norton Fitzwarren deaths: Two men arrested
description: Two young children were inside the property in the Somerset village at the time, police say.

title: Peng Shuai: China says tennis star case maliciously hyped up
description: As questions remain over the tennis star's wellbeing, China insists it is not a diplomatic matter.

title: Hameed makes half-century for England in Ashes warm-up
description: Haseeb Hameed impresses for England despite the first day of their Ashes warm-up against England Lions being restricted by rain.

title: Social care: MPs back change to funding cost cap in England
description: Critics say altering the way the cap will be calculated could disproportionately hit poorer people.

title: Social care: What could changes cost you and your family?
description: MPs have backed government plans to reform social care in England, but some say they don't go far enough.

title: Afghanistan: 100 days of Taliban rule
description: BBC reporter Yalda Hakim visits Kabul to look at four key areas of concern in Afghanistan.

title: Netball Quad Series: England to play Australia, New Zealand and South Africa in January
description: England will host Australia, New Zealand and South Africa in the Netball Quad Series in January.

title: Claims about social care reform fact-checked
description: Reality Check looks at claims made about the proposed new social care system.

title: 'Appalling' treatment of Paine is 'worst of an Australia Test captain in 50 years'
description: The treatment of Tim Paine has been the "worst of an Australia Test captain in 50 years", says Cricket Tasmania.

title: NBA: Milwaukee Bucks make franchise history in win over Orlando Magic
description: Reigning NBA champions the Milwaukee Bucks record the largest half-time lead in franchise history as they beat the Orlando Magic 123-92.

title: Darwin Nunez: Benfica striker wanted by Barcelona who could return to haunt Catalans
description: Darwin Nunez has already hurt Barcelona - a club he might have joined - once this season. If he does so again it could seriously dent their Champions League hopes.

title: Newburgh's 'wonky' Christmas lights return with a Covid twist
description: The town that gets children to design its Christmas lights has let them mark the pandemic in their special way.

title: Change to sepsis advice after mums' herpes deaths
description: Medical advice on how new mothers with sepsis should be treated is to change after two women died of a herpes infection.

title: Nurses' mental health: 'Most people in the NHS, they are sad'
description: An A&E nurse describes the anguish she's faced - and how a helpline inspired by Clap for Carers gave her hope.

title: Newspaper headlines: PM's Peppa Pig speech 'stokes Tory anger'
description: Tuesday's papers report reaction to Boris Johnson's address to business groups at the Port of Tyne.

title: Atom Bank introduces four-day working week without cutting pay
description: Atom Bank has cut its staff's hours by 10% without reducing their pay in a bid to improve wellbeing.

title: China bans Namewee's viral pop song Fragile
description: Fragile mocks Beijing and “little pinks”, a term referring to young nationalists who rush to the defence of the Chinese government.

title: Six ways shoebox-sized satellites are trying to change the world
description: The CubeSat began as an educational tool but is now helping out humanity

title: Can South Africa embrace renewable energy from the sun?
description: South Africa's main electricity company Eskom plans to switch from using coal to renewable energy.

title: 'Wait a second, am I in a cult?'
description: Jess, a former physiotherapy student, was recruited into the Shincheonji Church of Jesus on the campus of the University of Salford.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray conflict: What are Facebook and Twitter doing about hate speech?
description: Critics say social media firms are not doing enough to curb online hate speech around Ethiopia's war.

title: Iran nuclear programme: Threat of Israeli strike grows
description: As Iran's nuclear programme forges ahead, some see Israel running out of options to thwart it.
